intro: Melinia mexicana, commonly known as Mexican melinia, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically opposite and have a slightly hairy texture. Melinia mexicana is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
